metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14422 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Lib/ipaddress.py in Python through 3.8.3 improperly computes hash values in the IPv4Interface and IPv6Interface classes, which might allow a remote attacker to cause a denial of service if an application is affected by the performance of a dictionary containing IPv4Interface or IPv6Interface objects, and this attacker can cause many dictionary entries to be created. This is fixed in: v3.5.10, v3.5.10rc1; v3.6.12; v3.7.9; v3.8.4, v3.8.4rc1, v3.8.5, v3.8.6, v3.8.6rc1; v3.9.0, v3.9.0b4, v3.9.0b5, v3.9.0rc1, v3.9.0rc2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14422` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
libpython3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
libpython3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
libpython3.4-stdlib - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
libpython3.4-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
python3.4-examples - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
python3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
python3.4-venv - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python3.4 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm7').
python3.5 package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
